problem.markdown:
>>When does \(x^*\) increase with increasing \(\sigma_w\)?<< [x] \((r - c) / (r - s) \gt 0.5\) [ ] \((r - c) / (r - s) \lt 0.5\) [ ] \(x^*\) always increases with \(\sigma_w\). [x] When marginal profit is greater than marginal loss.
[explanation] If \(k = (r-c)/(r-s) \gt 0.5\) then \(x^*\) increases. In other words, when the marginal profit is greater than marginal loss, more variability actually brings less risk and therefore \(x^*\) increases with \(\sigma_w\). [explanation]
